attributes.action: Request That Heinz Removes Royal Crest & Houses of Parliament Image From Labels
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently Heinz decided to close the HP Sauce factory in Birmingham and move production to Holland. Heinz still wishes to promote HP's 'British ness' in its marketing campaign. 

HP has been an iconic brand in the UK for over 100 years and its factory has not only featured as part of the Birmingham Skyscape for many a year, but the smell has filled the air around Aston and will be missed. 

Campaigning to keep manufacture in the UK is pointless when the lock the gates for good later this week.

Now we need to concentrate our efforts on removing the image of the Houses of Parliament from the label, I am sure Heinz can use a windmill and still have the same sales… then request that the royal crest be removed from this Heinz brand. I also suggest that the houses of parliament ‘logo’ be transferred to Branston for its Brown sauce label.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
